turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Perfect.  Sandbag the father.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: And you crazy? He thinks shows like this are dumb.  If you didn't have an 800 number I could never get away with this --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Please --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: This is a grotesque violation of this man's personal life, but never mind --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: This is a complete disaster.  I wanted him to find a wife, but he's got the wrong one --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: How am I going to explain this to Walter?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Oh God, it's major.  He's kissing her on the lips.  I have to stop this.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Come on, Jonah --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Are you Annie?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I'm Jonah.  That's my dad.  His name is Sam.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Hi, Jonah.  Sam.  And who is this?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Howard.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Howard.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I think I'm going crazy, Tom. I really do.  Are you happily married?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I mean, why did you get married? Was it all fireworks and trumpets and --

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I got married because Betsy said we had to break up or get married.  So we get married.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: But when you met her, did you believe she was the only person for you? That in some mystical, cosmic way, it was fated?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Annie, when you meet someone and you're attracted to them, it just means that your subconscious is attracted to their subconscious, subconsciously.  So what we think of as chemistry is just two neuroses knowing that they are a perfect match.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I don't even know him.  But I'm having all these fantasies about a man I've never met, who lives in Seattle.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It rains nine months of the year in Seattle.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know, I know.  I do not want to move to Seattle.  But what I really don't want to do is end up always wondering what might have happened and knowing I could have done something. What do you think?  It's just cold feet, isn't it? Everyone panics before they get married, didn't you?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yes, I did.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Thank you, Tom.  I feel so much better just having blown this off.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Any time.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Everybody! Annie has an announcement --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Walter and I are engaged!

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's probably just the flowers --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We'll move them --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: The Historical Society wanted this and I never would give it to them --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Granny's dress.  Oh, Mom.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I notice these things are back in fashion.  Oh, honey.  He's a lovely man, Annie.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: I know.  He's wonderful, isn't he?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Are his folks nice?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: You'll love them.  We're going down to D.C.  tonight to be with them Christmas morning.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: How did it happen?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's silly, really.  I mean, I'd seen him at the office, obviously I'd seen him, he's the associate publisher, and then one day we both ordered sandwiches from the same place, and he got my lettuce and tomato sandwich on whole wheat, which of course he was allergic to, and I got his lettuce and tomato on white.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: How amazing.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It is, isn't it? You make millions of decisions that mean nothing and then one day you decide to order takeout and it changes your life.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Destiny takes a hand.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Oh, please.  Destiny's just something we've invented because we can't stand the fact that everything that happens is accidental.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Then how do you explain that you both ordered exactly the same sandwich except for the bread? How many people in this world like lettuce and tomato without something else like tuna?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It wasn't a sign.  It was a coincidence.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I was in Atlantic City with my family.  Cliff was a waiter. He talked me into sneaking out for a midnight walk on the Steel Pier.  I've probably told you this a million times, but I don't care.  And then he held my hand.  I was scared.  All sorts of thing were going through my head.  But after a while I forgot about them.  At one point I looked down, at our hands, and I couldn't tell which fingers were mine and which were his.  And I knew.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You know.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Magic.  It was magic.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Magic.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I knew we would be together forever, and that everything would be wonderful, just the way you feel about Walter. Walter.  It's quite a formal name, isn't it?  One of the things I truly knew was that your father and I were going to have a wonderful time ... in the sack I believe you call it --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mom!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Of course it took several years before everything worked like clockwork in that department, so don't be worried if it takes a while --

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Mom, we already...

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Well, fine, fine.  Fiddle da dee.  And how's it working?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Like... clockwork.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: So you'll get married in a new dress.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's a sign.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You don't believe in signs.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Sure you do.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sure you do --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You touch her for the first time, and suddenly... you're home.  It's almost like...

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Magic.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Magic.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hi.  So far so good.  So.  What should we talk about? How insecure we were in high school.  Shirley Votypka, the first girl I ever felt up. Health.  What about health? Did you know that eating six macadamia nuts is the equivalent of eating a steak?

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: Shhhh --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's you.

turns.speaker: ANNIE
turns.text: It's me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The one in the street.  I chased after you.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Which means --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The cabinets have to be redone --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Great.  This is great.  The whole town knows.  Just out of curiosity, how do you two know?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Grace heard it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Grace the dispatcher.  Great.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: The point is, take the client out to dinner and ask her to marry you and then maybe we won't have to redo the kitchen cabinets.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why me? What about Jay?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Sam, if you're not doing anything New Year's -- obviously you're not doing anything New Year's -- we're having some people over, all of them married, not one even remotely interested in playing around.  Does that sound great or what?  I can't think of the last time I was at a party when anything actually happened.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks, but I'll pass.  It's kind of a big night.  I don't like to leave Jonah alone.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Hello, Sam, this is Dr. Marcia Fieldstone on Network America.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm probably not interested in whatever you're selling.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: I'm not selling anything.  Your son called and asked for advice on how to find you a new wife.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Dr. Marcia Fieldstone of Network America.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jesus, are we on the air? Jonah, for God's sake --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not mad at you.  Okay, I'm not mad at you.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: I think it's hard for him to talk to you about all this. Maybe we could talk and it would make him feel a little better.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: All righ...

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Good.  How long ago did your wife die?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's been about a year and a half.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Have you had any relationship since?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Look, Doctor, I don't want to be rude, but --

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: And I don't want to invade your privacy --

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: We've been talking to -- well, let's just call him Sleepless in Seattle, and we'll be right back after this break with listener response, <u>your</u> response, to the things we've been discussing.  The number to call is...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's she talking about?

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Do you think there's somebody out there you could love as much as your wife? Maybe even more?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's hard to imagine.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: What are you going to do, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.  When I met my wife, it was so clear.  I just <u>knew</u>.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: What was it that made you know?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't think I could really describe it.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And if I could describe it, it probably wouldn't be on a radio show.  But what the hell.  It's not one specific thing.  It's more of a feeling.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: No last names, Jonah.  Hello there, you sound younger than our usual callers.  How come you're up so late?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's not that late in Seattle.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Got me there.  What's your Christmas wish, Jonah?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's not for me.  It's for my dad.  I think he needs a new wife.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: You don't like the one he was now?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: He doesn't have one now. That's the problem.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Where's your mom?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: She died.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that, Jonah.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I've been pretty sad, but I think my dad is worse.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: And you're worried about him.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I'm worried about him, he's worried about me, I ride my bike to school, he follows in the car, like I'm not supposed to know he's there.  Now it's Christmas, and you know what happens to people at Christmas.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's very hard for him to talk about this stuff.  It's like it makes him sadder.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: You want me to talk to him?

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Is he home right now?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Well, I think I can help a little more if I talk to him directly.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I don't know --

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: I'm sure he won't be angry once he realizes how concerned you are about him.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Okay, but if I get yelled at, I'm never gonna listen to this show again.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: Fair enough.

turns.speaker: DR. MARCIA FIELDSTONE
turns.text: I have no doubt that you're a good dad.  You can tell a lot from a person's voice.  But something must be missing if Jonah feels that you're still under a cloud.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Tell her how you don't sleep at night.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: They met at the Empire State Building, only they didn't. Never mind.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: What kind of person would write to someone they heard on the radio?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Just because someone's looking for a nice guy doesn't make them desperate.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: How about rapacious and love- starved?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: It is easier to be killed by a terrorist --

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: It is not --

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Right, right.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Hey, my plate is full.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, okay.  What's the big deal?  If she'll forget the new fireplace, I'll marry her. Just point me in the right direction.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Sandy has a girlfriend, Clenda ... She's a weightlifter, but it's not like her neck is bigger than her head or anything --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not asking you to set me up, Jay.  That's not what I need your help for.  I want to know what it's like over there.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: And that's what I'm trying to tell you.  What women are looking over, okay? Pecs and a cute butt.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You mean, like, "He has the cutest butt"? Where did I hear that recently?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Everywhere.  You can't even turn on the news without hearing about how some babe thought some guy's butt was cute.  Who the first babe to say this was I don't know, but it caught on.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: When's the latest time you were out there?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Seventy... eight.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Well.  Things are different. First, you have to be friends. You have to like each other. Then you neck.  This can go on for years.  Then you have tests.  Then you get to do it with a condom.  The good news is, split the check.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't think it could let a woman pay for dinner.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: Great.  They'll have a parade in your honor.  You'll be Man of the Year in Seattle Magazine.  Tira misu.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's tira misu?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You'll find out.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You'll see.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Some woman is going to want me to do it to her and I'm not going to know what it is.

turns.speaker: JAY
turns.text: You'll like it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is going to be tougher than I thought.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad, could you close the door?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: H and G.  Hi and goodbye.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Write her.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: It's Y. O. H.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Yeah.  What's that?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Your only hope.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: This is the best movie I've ever seen in my life.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I don't get it.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: You have to go to her, Jonah. You have to find her.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Do you know how much it costs to go to New York?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Nobody knows.  It changes practically every day.  How much money do you have?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Eighty dollars.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I have forty-two.  So that would definitely cover taxicabs, I think.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: But how am I going to get there?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Do you want an aisle or a window seat?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Window.

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: Do you want a fruit plate?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I don't know.  Do I?

turns.speaker: JESSICA
turns.text: I'd rather die than eat on an airplane.  I'm telling them you're twelve so you can fly unaccompanied and they won't make you be carried around by a stewardess and everything.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: There's somebody on the phone for you.  His name is Sam.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I can hear you walking around sometimes.  At first I thought it was a robber.  Go ahead, tell her, Dad.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't think I have to now.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The hopes are perfect -- beautiful, identical, smooth -- and they are for something really amazing I feel it in my bones --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's a spice rack.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We desperately need a spice rack.  Desperately.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad?  About last night?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's never happening again. Right?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Not.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: My feelings exactly.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How many people do you think heard that thing last night?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It plays in 50 states.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Nobody else is going to know it was us.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're right.  You better hope so.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad, I don't know about this one --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, you're changing your mind --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No, I'm not, but --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's the matter with this one? Wouldn't you like to have Imelda Marcos as your mother?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Does red pepper go under R or P?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: P.  Dad?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I forgot to mention.  Jed called --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Just out of curiosity, do you have any friends whose names don't begin with a J?  I feel like it was a failure of the imagination on our part naming you Jonah.  What is marjoram? Does anyone know?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Jed is having a slumber party New Year's Eve and he invited me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Fine.  Fine.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: So I can go.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sure.  Looking good.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Shouldn't you have used a toggle bolt?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I think I know how to have a spice rack.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Stressed.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Right.  I'm sorry, Jonah, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Just out of curiosity, how did they get our address?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: They called and asked for it.  "Dear Sleepless in Seattle. You are the most attractive man I've ever laid ears on."

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How did they get our phone number?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: You have to give them your phone number or they won't let you go on the air.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: "Dear Sleepless in Seattle: I am an SWF"--  What is that?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank God.  Something you don't know.  It's a single white female.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: This is no good.  She's looking for someone French.  Or Greek.  "Dear Sleepless in Seattle: I live in Tulsa." Where is that? --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oklahoma.  Do you know where that is?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Somewhere in the middle.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not going to think about what they're not teaching you in school.  I am not going to think about it.  Generally speaking I think we should rule out people who don't live somewhere near here --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: She's willing to fly anywhere.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: She looks like my third grade teacher.  I hated my third grade teacher.  Hold it! Wait a minute! She <u>is</u> my third grade teacher!

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad, you're not taking this seriously.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is not how you do it.  You want this on an English muffin or a bun?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: English muffin.  How do you do it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You see someone you like, you get a feeling about them, you ask them if they want to have a drink or --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: -- a slice of pizza --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: But not dinner necessarily on the first date because by the time you're halfway through dinner you might be sorry you asked them to dinner whereas if it's just a drink, if you like them you can always ask them for dinner but if you don't you can go home if you see what I mean.  I wonder if it still works this way.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It doesn't.  They ask you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm starting to notice that.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: If you get a new wife, I guess you'll have sex with her, huh?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Will she scratch up your back?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: In the movies women are always scratching up guy's back and screaming and stuff.  When they're having sex.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Whose show was this on?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Jed's got cables.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Go to sleep.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Hi, Dad.  Dad, this is Jessica.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It's nice to meet you, Jessica.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad, this is amazing.  If you play this backwards, it says "Paul is dead."

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It was sinking.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What was?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Our house.  There was water coming in all the windows.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're worried we're going to be all right.  We're going to be all right.  I remember sometimes you'd have nightmares as a baby.  Your mom would hold you and rock you and sing you a song.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Bye bye blackbird.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Is that what she used to sing?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I miss her.  What do you think happens to someone after they die?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Like do you believe in heaven?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I never did.  Or the whole idea of an afterlife.  But I don't know any more.  I have these dreams about... your mom... and we have long talks about... about you, and how you are, which she sort of knows but I tell her anyway.  So what is that? It's sort of an afterlife, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I'm starting to forget her.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I know.  But she's here, Jonah. Because I have you.  And as long as I have you, I have your Mom.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I... uh... have a date with someone Friday night.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This one's for both of us.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Sleepless and Son.  Baltimore.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I look stupid.  I look stupid, don't I? I look like I'm trying too hard.  I was going to get a haircut but then I thought I'd look like I just got a haircut.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: This is a good letter, Dad.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: The heels on these shoes are very large.  Why have I never noticed this? The heels on these shoes are grotesque.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Her name is Annie.  Annie Reed.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Now I'm late.  Bye.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Listen to this --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not now, Jonah --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Just this one part, okay?  "I have been an excellent third-baseman for as long as I or anyone else can remember, and I guarantee you will not get one past me"

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jonah, I'm leaving --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: WAIT!!!  -- "and while we're on the subject, let's just say right now that Brooks Robinson was the best third baseman ever. It's important that you agree with me on that because I'm from Baltimore."  Dad, she thinks Brooks Robinson is the greatest.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Everyone thinks Brooks Robinson is the greatest.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's a sign.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, right.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Here is Seattle.  And here is Baltimore.  Case closed.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: She doesn't want us to go to Baltimore.  She wants to meet us in New York City on Valentine's Day.  On top of the Empire State Building.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Perfect.  We'll be there.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I figure we could go to New York, catch the Knicks, and since we'd be there anyway, obviously we'd go to the Empire State Building --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There she is.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Why is she bringing that bag?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: She's going to cook something for us?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Okay, tiger.  Time for bed.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's only ten o'clock.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jonah!

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank Victoria for dinner.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Thanks for dinner.  I never saw anybody cook potatoes that way.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm glad you liked it.  Good night, Jonah.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't ever do that again.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I thought I saw a black widow spider.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What are you doing up?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I was thirsty.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: There's a bathroom upstairs.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: The water tastes better in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's true.  Why is that?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Did you call that radio station again?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Everyone at work heard you.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I just called for a second.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Long enough to call Victoria a ho.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It's a short word.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This is not a joke.  Thank God Victoria doesn't know.  It would really have hurt her feelings.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: If she knew, she'd never forgive me.  It would be hopeless for the two of you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Jonah, this isn't fair.  You don't know Victoria.  I hardly know her myself.  She is, in fact, a mystery to me.  She tosses her hair a lot.  Why does she do this? I have no idea.  Is it a twitch? Does she need a haircut? Should she use barrette so it doesn't keep falling in her face? These are things that I'm willing to get to the bottom of, and that is why I am dating her.  That is all I am doing. I am not marrying her.  Can you appreciate the difference? That's what single people do, they try people on and they see if they fit.  But nobody fits perfectly, everyone is an adjustment.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Was Mom an adjustment?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm never going to meet anyone who's going to measure up to your mom in your eyes? What do you think? There's a perfect woman walking around out there?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: God, she's beautiful.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Victoria? She's okay.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Dad, I was talking to Jessica about reincarnation, and she thinks that probably you knew Annie in another life.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who is Annie?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: The one who wrote us.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: The reason I know this and you don't is that I'm younger and purer so I'm more in touch with cosmic forces.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I sincerely hope you are not going to marry Jessica.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Have you seen my wallet?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It might be in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm only going to be away one night, okay, and Clarise will be here.  You'll have a swell time.  You'll watch a little Geraldo, some Nightmare on Elm Street 12, I'll never know.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Are you going with her?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I have to have a life.  I have to do things that I want with people my own age.  It's none of your business who I am going out with.  I don't give a good goddam if you're angry --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: This is the one I like.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Fine.  I won't say anything. You can marry Count Dracula.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank you, Jonah.  But the point is, I am not asking permission.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: What's wrong with Annie?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Shut up?  Shut up???  Mom never did that.  Mom never said shut up to me.  Mom never yelled at me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This conversation is finished.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: You said we could go to New York.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Did not.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Did too.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can't know what I said, but we're not going.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I'm not leaving this room until you say yes.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Goddammit, I am sick of this --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What if I couldn't get to you?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I was scared of what you were gonna do.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: When I found you?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: If I didn't go.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Listen, have I ever done anything really stupid?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I mean, so far, have I screwed it up for you?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I can't believe you flew first class.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: It was all they had.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Maybe we'll get a dog when we get back.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do you mean, okay? Wouldn't you like a dog?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Hi, Sam.  And let me guess -- you must be Jonah.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Hi.  He should book now because we can get an excursion fare. Jessica's parents are travel agents and --

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Do you like baseball?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Yes, I do.  In fact, my firm has box seats for the Mariners. Why don't we all go next week?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: What about camping?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: What about it?

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Do you like it?

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: I went camping once.  I love to brush my teeth in a brook and floss with a weed.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: We ought to start camping again, Dad.

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: Sure.  I'd really like that. Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: VICTORIA
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: JONAH
turns.text: I think they're announcing your flight.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: LULU
turns.text: Hi.  Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LULU
turns.text: You must be Jonah.

turns.speaker: LULU
turns.text: We live two piers over, don't we? Number 12, right? We're having like a really neat open house today from like four to whenever if you care to stop by.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks, but... we've got plans.

turns.speaker: LULU
turns.text: Well, here's the number.  If you ever find yourself Sleepless, give us a call.  We also... do babysitting.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Five minutes in the microwave. Any one of them, five minutes and done.  Ready to eat.  Do you know how to make juice?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Microwave.  Five minutes.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Eventually, in a few months, you'll start seeing women, you'll meet someone.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Move on.  Right.  That's what I'm going to do.  In a few months, boom, I'll be fine, I'll just grow a new heart.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: I'm sorry --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: God, it's wonderful to see you. Where's Greg?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: He's over at the boat show. He'll be by later.  It's so beautiful here.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: You saw her in the airport and then here?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I tried to talk to her...  It was like I knew her.  Weird.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: How's Jonah taking it?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: It'll take him a while to come around.  A month ago he called one of those radio call-in shows and told them I needed a wife --

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: You're kidding --

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Now that I'm seeing someone, it's a whole other thing.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: It's a little derivative.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: "An Affair To Remember." Did you ever see it? Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr.  Before that it was called "Love Affair With Irene Dunne And Charles Boyer."

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Anyway, Victoria's nice.

turns.speaker: SUZY
turns.text: Would you follow <U>her</U> through an airport?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Look, I met somebody.  She's good, and capable and smart. We hit it off.  We can't spend your life chasing after fantasies.
